Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage.
The clash in Dharamsala between these two unbeaten teams isn't a mere group-stage game; it carries the weight of history.
Players from these two sides occupy three of the top-four positions on the run charts, as well as each of the top-three slots on the wickets list.
Both teams have centurions in their top-three: fast bowlers with outstanding PowerPlay records, left-arm spinners to squeeze the middle-overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather looks superb for today, between 17° and 19° for the whole match.
Dharamsala has been a venue where the fast bowlers have found some joy.
This has been the most bowling friendly venue in this World Cup so far - the only venue where both pace and spin average under 30.
The pitch at the HPCA Stadium in Dharamshala is a bowler-friendly one, particularly favouring fast bowlers.
Tom Latham revealed that Dew had begun to form as early as 5PM in the days leading up to the game, so batting second might just continue to be an advantage.
